channel.title: Less Than Or Equal?
channel.description:
What would be the correct way to code a less-than-or-equal object for Axoloti?
XML for the symbol seems to be <=
Using the ==.axo object as a template, this seems like it should work but I get error messages:
<code.krate><![CDATA[outlet_out= inlet_in1<=inlet_in2 ;]]></code.krate>
Is there a different/better/correct way to express <= for Axoloti?

item.title: Less Than Or Equal?
item.dc:creator: @pmj Phil Julian
item.description:
@pmj wrote:

DrJustice:

It seems like there's some unicode characters in there that the compiler doesn't like

Ah, that's helped - thanks

I was also using the textural version of the expression for both the object name and calculation, where it works fine with "lt" etc as the object name and a straight <= for the calculation.

Read full topic

item.title: Less Than Or Equal?
item.dc:creator: @DrJustice
item.description:
@DrJustice wrote:

pmj:

/Users/pmjulian/Documents/axoloti/build/xpatch.cpp:588:1: error: stray '\342' in program
;class instance≤__1{
^

It seems like there's some unicode characters in there that the compiler doesn't like. In the names in the XML file you can only use a-z, 0-9, underscore and space since these end up as identifiers in the C++ source code that gets generated from your .axo files (spaces get converted to underscores) . If I'm not mistaken you have given your object the name "≤" - try e.g. "less than or equal" instead.

Read full topic

item.title: Less Than Or Equal?
item.dc:creator: @gabriel
item.description:
@gabriel wrote:

Hm... I do not follow what the error is, but I just searched for the axo files contents and yes "<=" should work. See for example decode.axo

Read full topic
